trans-unit.source: Operations on User Defined Functions
trans-unit.target: Operations on User Defined Functions

trans-unit.source: Operations on User Defined Functions
trans-unit.target: Operations on User Defined Functions

trans-unit.source: A user defined function (UFD) is a side effect free piece of application logic written in JavaScript.
trans-unit.target: A user defined function (UFD) is a side effect free piece of application logic written in JavaScript.

trans-unit.source: It allows developers to construct a query operator, thus extending the core of the DocumentDB query language.
trans-unit.target: It allows developers to construct a query operator, thus extending the core of the DocumentDB query language.

trans-unit.source: Like stored procedures, UDFs live in the confines of a collection, thus confining the application logic to the collection.
trans-unit.target: Like stored procedures, UDFs live in the confines of a collection, thus confining the application logic to the collection.

trans-unit.source: The user defined function resource is represented by <legacyItalic><legacyBold>udfs</legacyBold></legacyItalic> in the <externalLink><linkText>DocumentDB resource model</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/documentdb-resources/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: The user defined function resource is represented by <legacyItalic><legacyBold>udfs</legacyBold></legacyItalic> in the <externalLink><linkText>DocumentDB resource model</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/documentdb-resources/</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: There is a quota limit on the number of UDFs created in a collection.
trans-unit.target: There is a quota limit on the number of UDFs created in a collection.

trans-unit.source: For more information on the limits and quotas, see <externalLink><linkText>DocumentDB limits</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/documentdb-limits/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on the limits and quotas, see <externalLink><linkText>DocumentDB limits</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/documentdb-limits/</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Similar to stored procedures, the UDFs resource has a fixed schema.
trans-unit.target: Similar to stored procedures, the UDFs resource has a fixed schema.

trans-unit.source: The body property contains the application logic.
trans-unit.target: The body property contains the application logic.

trans-unit.source: The following example illustrates the JSON construct of a user defined function.
trans-unit.target: The following example illustrates the JSON construct of a user defined function.

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: id
trans-unit.target: id

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: This is a user settable property.
trans-unit.target: This is a user settable property.

trans-unit.source: It is a unique name to identify the UDF.
trans-unit.target: It is a unique name to identify the UDF.

trans-unit.source: The <legacyBold>id</legacyBold> must not exceed 255 characters.
trans-unit.target: The <legacyBold>id</legacyBold> must not exceed 255 characters.

trans-unit.source: body
trans-unit.target: body

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: This is a user settable property.
trans-unit.target: This is a user settable property.

trans-unit.source: This is the body of the UDF.
trans-unit.target: This is the body of the UDF.

trans-unit.source: _rid
trans-unit.target: _rid

trans-unit.source: This is a system generated property.
trans-unit.target: This is a system generated property.

trans-unit.source: The resource ID (_rid) is a unique identifier that is also hierarchical per the resource stack on the resource model.
trans-unit.target: The resource ID (_rid) is a unique identifier that is also hierarchical per the resource stack on the resource model.

trans-unit.source: It is used internally for placement and navigation of the UDF resource.
trans-unit.target: It is used internally for placement and navigation of the UDF resource.

trans-unit.source: _ts
trans-unit.target: _ts

trans-unit.source: This is a system generated property.
trans-unit.target: This is a system generated property.

trans-unit.source: It specifies the last updated timestamp of the resource.
trans-unit.target: It specifies the last updated timestamp of the resource.

trans-unit.source: The value is a timestamp.
trans-unit.target: The value is a timestamp.

trans-unit.source: _self
trans-unit.target: _self

trans-unit.source: This is a system generated property.
trans-unit.target: This is a system generated property.

trans-unit.source: It is the unique addressable URI for the resource.
trans-unit.target: It is the unique addressable URI for the resource.

trans-unit.source: _etag
trans-unit.target: _etag

trans-unit.source: This is a system generated property that specifies the resource etag required for optimistic concurrency control.
trans-unit.target: This is a system generated property that specifies the resource etag required for optimistic concurrency control.

trans-unit.source: The following are the allowable operations on UDFs.
trans-unit.target: The following are the allowable operations on UDFs.

trans-unit.source: Create a UDF
trans-unit.target: Create a UDF

trans-unit.source: Replace a UDF
trans-unit.target: Replace a UDF

trans-unit.source: List UDFs
trans-unit.target: List UDFs

trans-unit.source: Delete a UDF
trans-unit.target: Delete a UDF

trans-unit.source: Query UDFs
trans-unit.target: Query UDFs

trans-unit.source: Query documents (referencing UDFs)
trans-unit.target: Query documents (referencing UDFs)

trans-unit.source: Aside from a executing an UDF in a query, the rest of the REST operations are similar to the ones for documents, as specified in <legacyLink xlink:href="9ee04fa0-e636-42ff-8ae5-e45975c0971f" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Operations on DocumentDB Documents</legacyLink>.
trans-unit.target: Aside from a executing an UDF in a query, the rest of the REST operations are similar to the ones for documents, as specified in <legacyLink xlink:href="9ee04fa0-e636-42ff-8ae5-e45975c0971f" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Operations on DocumentDB Documents</legacyLink>.

trans-unit.source: Instead of performing the operations against the <legacyItalic><legacyBold>docs</legacyBold></legacyItalic>, they are preformed against the <legacyItalic><legacyBold>udfs</legacyBold></legacyItalic> resource path under a particular collection.
trans-unit.target: Instead of performing the operations against the <legacyItalic><legacyBold>docs</legacyBold></legacyItalic>, they are preformed against the <legacyItalic><legacyBold>udfs</legacyBold></legacyItalic> resource path under a particular collection.

trans-unit.source: Hence, we will not elaborate about each of the operations again here.
trans-unit.target: Hence, we will not elaborate about each of the operations again here.

trans-unit.source: For information on how UDFs work, including executing an UDF in a query, see <externalLink><linkText>DocumentDB programming: Stored procedures, triggers, and UDFs</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/documentdb-programming/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For information on how UDFs work, including executing an UDF in a query, see <externalLink><linkText>DocumentDB programming: Stored procedures, triggers, and UDFs</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/documentdb-programming/</linkUri></externalLink>.
